title: Dow Jones Futures: Tesla Falls On Fremont Plant Drama, China Sales; Microsoft, Netflix Near Buys In Stock Market Rally
summary:
Tesla Fremont Plant LawsuitThe Tesla Fremont plant, the electric vehicle maker's main manufacturing facility, has been shut down since March 23 due to coronavirus shutdown orders in Alameda County.
Microsoft Stock, Netflix Stock: Earnings And ChillMeanwhile, the current stock market rally continues to gain momentum.
Microsoft stock, Vertex stock and Netflix stock boast best-possible IBD Composite Ratings of 99.
Vertex stock, Netflix stock and Microsoft stock also are on SwingTrader.
Coronavirus Stock Market RallyThe current stock market rally had a powerful, entering a bullish power trend.
text:
Dow Jones futures extended losses Monday morning, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures. Tesla stock fell on multiple headlines. CEO Elon Musk threatened to pull manufacturing out of California while Tesla (TSLA) sued Alameda County for keeping the Fremont plant closed. Meanwhile, Tesla China sales fell sharply in April.

X

Microsoft (MSFT), Insulet (PODD) and Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) are all in buy range in the current stock market rally, while Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX) and Netflix (NFLX) are just below new entries. All have reported earnings recently, removing a major risk.

The stock market rally gained momentum in the past week, with the Nasdaq and growth stocks leading the way.

Dow Jones Futures Today

Dow Jones futures fell 0.8% vs. fair value, reversing solid overnight gains. S&P 500 futures sank 0.9% while Nasdaq 100 futures retreated 0.7%. While Dow Jones futures have not been as volatile in the strong stock market rally as they were during the coronavirus crash, big overnight moves are not unusual.

Remember that overnight action in Dow futures, Tesla stock and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular stock market session.

Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.

Tesla Fremont Plant Lawsuit

The Tesla Fremont plant, the electric vehicle maker's main manufacturing facility, has been shut down since March 23 due to coronavirus shutdown orders in Alameda County. Tesla had planned to reopen the Fremont plant on Friday after Calif. Gov. Gavin Newsom said manufacturing could resume in the state. But Newsom said local orders remain in effect and Alameda said Tesla can't reopen. Its current order closing nonessential businesses runs through May 31.

Tesla filed a lawsuit in federal court Saturday, saying the shutdown order has "no rational basis" and that the local order shouldn't trump state rules.

Hours earlier, Elon Musk tweeted that he'll move Tesla's headquarters and future efforts out of the state, and perhaps shutter its Fremont plant.

Frankly, this is the final straw. Tesla will now move its HQ and future programs to Texas/Nevada immediately. If we even retain Fremont manufacturing activity at all, it will be dependen on how Tesla is treated in the future. Tesla is the last carmaker left in CA. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) May 9, 2020

An Alameda County supervisor said Saturday that the county and Tesla had been close to a deal to reopen the Fremont plant on May 18, but Musk wanted to open on Friday, May 8.

General Motors (GM), Ford (F) and Fiat Chrysler (FCAU) plan to reopen U.S. plants on May 18. Toyota (TM) will open its U.S. plants on May 11 while Mercedes-Benz has reopened factories in the South. Automakers are already operating several European plants.

The long Tesla Fremont plant closure raises questions about cash burn. But it also highlights longer-term questions about the Fremont plant, or any other U.S. manufacturing site.

Tesla China Sales Fall Sharply

Tesla sold just 3,635 Model 3 vehicles in China last month, according to the China Passenger Car Association. That's a 64% drop from the 10,160 sold in March. That came even as Tesla Shanghai made well over 10,000 Model 3 sedans.

Sales may have slowed due to a Tesla price cut set to take effect to qualify for revised subsidies. Tesla also began taking orders last month for made-in-China higher-end Model 3 sedans.

Tesla Shanghai has been on an extended shutdown to start May.

If the China growth story wavers, Tesla stock could face real trouble, especially with the Fremont plant closed.

China electric vehicle sales overall rebounded in April vs. March. Nio (NIO), the so-called Tesla in China, sold 3,155 luxury electric SUVs last month, more than double its March sales pace.

Tesla stock, which has rallied in recent months on China growth and on Friday on Fremont plant hopes, fell modestly early Monday.

Microsoft Stock, Netflix Stock: Earnings And Chill

Meanwhile, the current stock market rally continues to gain momentum. Many leading stocks are now extended. But Microsoft stock, Insulet stock and Chipotle stock are all in buy range. Vertex stock and Netflix stock are extended from breakouts, but are just below possible new entries.

All five of these stocks have already reported earnings, so that major risk is off the table for months.

Microsoft stock, Vertex stock and Netflix stock boast best-possible IBD Composite Ratings of 99. Chipotle has a strong 93 Composite Rating. Insulet stock has an 81 CR, but analysts are betting on revived earnings later this year. Tesla stock has a 97 Composite Rating.

The relative strength lines for all of these stocks, including TSLA stock, are at or near record highs. The RS line, the blue line in the charts below, track a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index.

MSFT stock, CMG stock, VRTX stock and NFLX stock are all on IBD Leaderboard. So is PODD stock rival Dexcom (DXCM). Vertex stock, Netflix stock and Microsoft stock also are on SwingTrader. Netflix stock and Vertex stock are on the IBD 50 list.

Microsoft stock is a founding member of the IBD Long-Term Leaders list.

Coronavirus News

Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 4.20 million. Covid-19 deaths are at least 284,000.

Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have exceeded 1.36 million, with deaths reaching 80,000.

New coronavirus cases in the U.S. rose by 20,329 on Sunday, the smallest gain since March 29. Keep in mind that reported new cases tend to be lower on Sunday. Still, it's encouraging. New coronavirus cases in the U.S. have plateaued for several weeks, but that's partly due to a continued increase in testing. The share of positive Covid-19 tests has fallen dramatically in the last few weeks.

States are reopening their battered economies at various speeds. It's possible these moves will spur a new wave of infections, but testing, continued social distancing and mask-wearing may counter that.

On the flip side, several White House staffers have tested positive for Covid-19 in recent days.

Meanwhile, Russia has more than 220,000 coroanvirus cases, with big daily increases. In the past several days it's surpassed France and Germany and is in the process of overtaking the U.K., Italy and soon Spain. Brazil and India area among other notable countries with big increases in confirmed Covid-19 cases.

Coronavirus Stock Market Rally

The current stock market rally had a powerful, entering a bullish power trend.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 2.6% last, the S&P 500 index 3.5% and the Nasdaq composite 6%. The Nasdaq is now positive for the year again, with its 50-day moving average moving higher.

Among the best ETFs, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (FFTY) jumped 6.9%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) soared 9%. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH) popped 7.2%.

Read The Big Picture every day to stay in sync with the market direction and leading stocks and sectors.

Microsoft Stock

Microsoft stock jumped 5.8% last week to 184.68. That's still in buy range from an 180.10 handle from a double-bottom base. Microsoft earnings on Aug. 29 were better than expected, with revenue growth the best in six quarters. Cloud-related revenue led the way, with Azure cloud-computing services revenue up 62%.

Netflix Stock

Netflix stock pulled back from record highs after earnings, retreating to the top of its prior base but staging a bullish upside reversal. Netflix stock rose 4.9% last week to 435.55. That's near the top of its recent consolidation. At three weeks, that's far too short to be a proper base. But investors could treat 449.62 as a Netflix stock entry.

Q1 earnings on April 21 missed views but Netflix subscriber growth surged as people stuck at home and movie theaters closed spurred people to stream Netflix.

Chipotle Stock

Chipotle stock rose 3.2% on Friday to 925.83, clearing a 909.98 cup-with-handle buy point, according to MarketSmith analysis. CMG stock rallied 5.8% last week.

Chipotle earnings fell in Q1, but beat views. Same-store sales climbed xxx despite. Digital sales surged 81%, with CEO Brian Niccol saying he sees signs of "cooking fatigue" among Americans. Chipotle stock surged 12% on April 22, the day after earnings.

Vertex Stock

Vertex stock pulled back heading into earnings, undercutting a 249.95 cup-base buy point a few times but never closing below that level. But in the days after its Aug. 29 earnings report, Vertex stock rebounded, once again clearing the buy zone. VRTX stock climbed 6.6% last week to 271.63. Much like Netflix stock, Vertex stock would be actionable is it clears a short consolidation. That Vertex stock buy point is 277.90.

Vertex earnings skyrocketed 125% in Q1, blowing out views, with sales up 76%. The biotech giant also raised guidance, highly unusual in the current environment.

Insulet Stock

Insulet stock cleared a 209.94 cup-with-handle buy point last Thursday, just before earnings after the close. PODD stock initially tumbled on Friday, falling as low as 200, but then reversed higher, ultimately closing up 1.15% to 217.63. Insulet stock shot up nearly 12% for the week.

Insulet lost 3 cents share in Q1, worse than expected. Revenue topped views, but the insulin pump maker trimmed full-year revenue targets. Wall Street does seem improving Insulet earnings in the next few quarters.

The diabetes product space is doing well, a plus for Insulet stock. But the leader in that space appears to be Dexcom stock, which is greatly extended from a base.

Tesla Fremont's Future

Elon Musk clearly wants to pressure Alameda County to let Tesla Fremont reopen quickly. If Musk did decide to shift Tesla manufacturing to another site — perhaps as part of a Cybertruck facility — several states would likely offer subsidies. But a new plant would still take 12-18 months. Moving manufacturing from California, easily the biggest state for Tesla sales, could hurt the brand among its core customers.

Meanwhile, there are questions about the longer-term future for any Tesla auto plant in the U.S.

In the fourth quarter of 2019, the Tesla Fremont facility accounted for all the company's electric-vehicle production, aside from a handful of Model 3 sedans from the brand-new Shanghai site. U.S. demand was weakening. But China demand was strong, while Tesla was still expanding into some European markets and expiring subsidies fueled demand in countries in Netherlands.

But in the first quarter, the Shanghai plant ramped up production, increasingly addressing China demand. U.S. demand remained soft, even with an early Model Y launch. In Europe, sales fell in many countries, with Tesla's market share declining significantly. Several EVs have launched in Europe this year, with the Volkswagen ID.3 line due this summer. Tesla has no more European markets to enter.

In the near term, auto sales overall may be weak in the U.S. and Europe due to their massive recessions. But even after an economic recovery, with Tesla sales already well off their highs in the U.S. and possibly peaking in Europe, will ex-China demand be strong enough to keep the Fremont plant busy?

Keep in mind that Tesla plans to build another factory outside Berlin. While construction hasn't started yet, Tesla aims to have Giga Berlin up and running by 2021.

So in little more than two years, the Tesla Fremont plant is set to shift from serving the world serving expanding new markets to essentially just the U.S.

Down the road, Tesla will have incentives to export autos from its Shanghai plant, taking further production from Fremont. If Tesla Shanghai production exceeds China demand, the pressure will build quickly.

If you're a Tesla bull, you can see huge growth and continued strong share in booming electric vehicle market. But if that doesn't come to pass, Tesla production capacity could soon far exceed demand.

Tesla Stock

Tesla stock fell 2.5% before the open Monday. Shares rose 5% to 819.42 on Friday on Fremont plant reopening hopes. TSLA stock shot up 17% for the week.

If the Fremont plant opens relatively soon, the Tesla stock impact may be relatively minor. But the longer the Tesla Fremont plant is closed, the bigger the drain on the company's cash will be. Meanwhile, Tesla's China sales are an issue.

It's not clear what a proper Tesla stock entry would be. Tesla stock broke out past a 775.05 handle entry in late April. But shares then reversed lower on April 30 and plunged further on May 1, invalidating that buy point. Tesla stock did find support at its 21-day line and rebounded last week. One could view the chart and see a new handle, with a Tesla stock buy point of 869.92.

But the base is extremely deep and volatile. Together with significant uncertainty about Tesla production now and demand in the coming months, investors may want to await more clarity.

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>Dow Jones futures extended losses Monday morning, along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures. Tesla stock fell on multiple headlines. CEO Elon Musk threatened to pull manufacturing out of California while <strong>Tesla</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSLA' target='_blank'>TSLA</a>) sued Alameda County for keeping the Fremont plant closed. Meanwhile, Tesla China sales fell sharply in April.</p>

<p><strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>), <strong>Insulet</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=PODD' target='_blank'>PODD</a>) and <strong>Chipotle Mexican Grill</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=CMG' target='_blank'>CMG</a>) are all in buy range in the current stock market rally, while <strong>Vertex Pharmaceuticals</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=VRTX' target='_blank'>VRTX</a>) and <strong>Netflix</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NFLX' target='_blank'>NFLX</a>) are just below new entries. All have reported earnings recently, removing a major risk.</p>
<p>The stock market rally gained momentum in the past week, with the Nasdaq and growth stocks leading the way.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Futures Today</h2>
<p>Dow Jones futures fell 0.8% vs. fair value, reversing solid overnight gains. S&P 500 futures sank 0.9% while Nasdaq 100 futures retreated 0.7%. While Dow Jones futures have not been as volatile in the strong stock market rally as they were during the coronavirus crash, big overnight moves are not unusual.</p>
<p>Remember that overnight action in <a href="http://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-futures-premarket-dow-futures-sp-futures-nasdaq-futures/">Dow futures</a>, Tesla stock and elsewhere doesn't necessarily translate into actual trading in the next regular <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">stock market</a> session.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843"><strong>Join IBD experts as they analyze actionable stocks in the coronavirus stock market rally on IBD Live.</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Tesla Fremont Plant Lawsuit</h2>
<p>The Tesla Fremont plant, the electric vehicle maker's main manufacturing facility, has been shut down since March 23 due to coronavirus shutdown orders in Alameda County. Tesla had planned to reopen the Fremont plant on Friday after Calif. Gov. Gavin Newsom said manufacturing could resume in the state. But Newsom said local orders remain in effect and Alameda said Tesla can't reopen. Its current order closing nonessential businesses runs through May 31.</p>
<p>Tesla filed a lawsuit in federal court Saturday, saying the shutdown order has "no rational basis" and that the local order shouldn't trump state rules.</p>
<p>Hours earlier, Elon Musk tweeted that he'll move Tesla's headquarters and future efforts out of the state, and perhaps shutter its Fremont plant.</p>
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet">
<p dir="ltr" lang="en">Frankly, this is the final straw. Tesla will now move its HQ and future programs to Texas/Nevada immediately. If we even retain Fremont manufacturing activity at all, it will be dependen on how Tesla is treated in the future. Tesla is the last carmaker left in CA.</p>
<p>— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1259162367285317633?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">May 9, 2020</a></p></blockquote>
<p>An Alameda County supervisor said Saturday that the county and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/09/business/coronavirus-elon-musk-tesla-california.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Tesla had been close to a deal</a> to reopen the Fremont plant on May 18, but Musk wanted to open on Friday, May 8.</p>
<p><strong>General Motors</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=GM' target='_blank'>GM</a>), <strong>Ford</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=F' target='_blank'>F</a>) and <strong>Fiat Chrysler</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FCAU' target='_blank'>FCAU</a>) plan to reopen U.S. plants on May 18. <strong>Toyota</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TM' target='_blank'>TM</a>) will open its U.S. plants on May 11 while Mercedes-Benz has reopened factories in the South. Automakers are already operating several European plants.</p>
<p>The long Tesla Fremont plant closure raises questions about cash burn. But it also highlights longer-term questions about the Fremont plant, or any other U.S. manufacturing site.</p>
<h2>Tesla China Sales Fall Sharply</h2>
<p>Tesla sold just 3,635 Model 3 vehicles in China last month, according to the China Passenger Car Association. That's a 64% drop from the 10,160 sold in March. That came even as Tesla Shanghai made well over 10,000 Model 3 sedans.</p>
<p>Sales may have slowed due to a Tesla price cut set to take effect to qualify for revised subsidies. Tesla also began taking orders last month for made-in-China higher-end Model 3 sedans.</p>
<p>Tesla Shanghai has been on an extended shutdown to start May.</p>
<p>If the China growth story wavers, Tesla stock could face real trouble, especially with the Fremont plant closed.</p>
<p>China electric vehicle sales overall rebounded in April vs. March. <strong>Nio</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=NIO' target='_blank'>NIO</a>), the so-called Tesla in China, sold 3,155 luxury electric SUVs last month, more than double its March sales pace.</p>
<p>Tesla stock, which has rallied in recent months on China growth and on Friday on Fremont plant hopes, fell modestly early Monday.</p>
<h2>Microsoft Stock, Netflix Stock: Earnings And Chill</h2>
<p>Meanwhile, the current stock market rally continues to gain momentum. Many leading stocks are now extended. But Microsoft stock, Insulet stock and Chipotle stock are all in buy range. Vertex stock and Netflix stock are extended from breakouts, but are just below possible new entries.</p>
<p>All five of these stocks have already reported earnings, so that major risk is off the table for months.</p>
<p>Microsoft stock, Vertex stock and Netflix stock boast best-possible <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">IBD Composite Ratings</a> of 99. Chipotle has a strong 93 Composite Rating. Insulet stock has an 81 CR, but analysts are betting on revived earnings later this year. Tesla stock has a 97 Composite Rating.</p>
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">relative strength lines</a> for all of these stocks, including TSLA stock, are at or near record highs. The RS line, the blue line in the charts below, track a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index.</p>
<p>MSFT stock, CMG stock, VRTX stock and NFLX stock are all on <a href="https://leaderboard.investors.com/#/leaders/leadersnearabuypoint">IBD Leaderboard</a>. So is PODD stock rival <strong>Dexcom</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=DXCM' target='_blank'>DXCM</a>). Vertex stock, Netflix stock and Microsoft stock also are on <a href="https://swingtrader.investors.com/#/">SwingTrader</a>. Netflix stock and Vertex stock are on the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-lists/ibd-50/">IBD 50</a> list.</p>
<p>Microsoft stock is a founding member of the <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders</a> list.</p>
<h2>Coronavirus News</h2>
<p>Coronavirus cases worldwide have topped 4.20 million. Covid-19 deaths are at least 284,000.</p>
<p>Coronavirus cases in the U.S. have exceeded 1.36 million, with deaths reaching 80,000.</p>
<p>New coronavirus cases in the U.S. rose by 20,329 on Sunday, the smallest gain since March 29. Keep in mind that reported new cases tend to be lower on Sunday. Still, it's encouraging. New coronavirus cases in the U.S. have plateaued for several weeks, but that's partly due to a continued increase in testing. The share of positive Covid-19 tests has fallen dramatically in the last few weeks.</p>
<p>States are reopening their battered economies at various speeds. It's possible these moves will spur a new wave of infections, but testing, continued social distancing and mask-wearing may counter that.</p>
<p>On the flip side, several White House staffers have tested positive for Covid-19 in recent days.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, Russia has more than 220,000 coroanvirus cases, with big daily increases. In the past several days it's surpassed France and Germany and is in the process of overtaking the U.K., Italy and soon Spain. Brazil and India area among other notable countries with big increases in confirmed Covid-19 cases.</p>
<h2>Coronavirus Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>The current stock market rally had a powerful, entering a <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-update-raging-bull-market-continues/">bullish power trend</a>.</p>
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 2.6% last, the S&P 500 index 3.5% and the Nasdaq composite 6%. The Nasdaq is now positive for the year again, with its 50-day moving average moving higher.</p>
<p>Among the <a href="https://www.investors.com/etfs-and-funds/etfs/best-etfs-exchange-traded-funds/">best ETFs</a>, the Innovator IBD 50 ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) jumped 6.9%. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=IGV' target='_blank'>IGV</a>) soared 9%. The VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SMH' target='_blank'>SMH</a>) popped 7.2%.</p>
<p>Read <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">The Big Picture</a> every day to stay in sync with the market direction and leading stocks and sectors.</p>
<h2>Microsoft Stock</h2>
<p>Microsoft stock jumped 5.8% last week to 184.68. That's still in buy range from an 180.10 handle from a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/when-buy-growth-stocks-why-double-bottom-base-fuels-strong-breakouts/">double-bottom base</a>. Microsoft earnings on Aug. 29 were better than expected, with revenue growth the best in six quarters. Cloud-related revenue led the way, with Azure cloud-computing services revenue up 62%.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=msft'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Netflix Stock</h2>
<p>Netflix stock pulled back from record highs after earnings, retreating to the top of its prior base but staging a bullish upside reversal. Netflix stock rose 4.9% last week to 435.55. That's near the top of its recent consolidation. At three weeks, that's far too short to be a proper base. But investors could treat 449.62 as a Netflix stock entry.</p>
<p>Q1 earnings on April 21 missed views but Netflix subscriber growth surged as people stuck at home and movie theaters closed spurred people to stream Netflix.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=nflx'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Chipotle Stock</h2>
<p>Chipotle stock rose 3.2% on Friday to 925.83, clearing a 909.98 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle</a> buy point, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith analysis</a>. CMG stock rallied 5.8% last week.</p>
<p>Chipotle earnings fell in Q1, but beat views. Same-store sales climbed xxx despite. Digital sales surged 81%, with CEO Brian Niccol saying he sees signs of "cooking fatigue" among Americans. Chipotle stock surged 12% on April 22, the day after earnings.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=cmg'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Vertex Stock</h2>
<p>Vertex stock pulled back heading into earnings, undercutting a 249.95 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/corner-cup-without-handle/">cup-base</a> buy point a few times but never closing below that level. But in the days after its Aug. 29 earnings report, Vertex stock rebounded, once again clearing the buy zone. VRTX stock climbed 6.6% last week to 271.63. Much like Netflix stock, Vertex stock would be actionable is it clears a short consolidation. That Vertex stock buy point is 277.90.</p>
<p>Vertex earnings skyrocketed 125% in Q1, blowing out views, with sales up 76%. The biotech giant also raised guidance, highly unusual in the current environment.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=vrtx'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Insulet Stock</h2>
<p>Insulet stock cleared a 209.94 cup-with-handle <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a> last Thursday, just before earnings after the close. PODD stock initially tumbled on Friday, falling as low as 200, but then reversed higher, ultimately closing up 1.15% to 217.63. Insulet stock shot up nearly 12% for the week.</p>
<p>Insulet lost 3 cents share in Q1, worse than expected. Revenue topped views, but the insulin pump maker trimmed full-year revenue targets. Wall Street does seem improving Insulet earnings in the next few quarters.</p>
<p>The diabetes product space is doing well, a plus for Insulet stock. But the leader in that space appears to be Dexcom stock, which is greatly extended from a base.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns "><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=podd'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Tesla Fremont's Future</h2>
<p>Elon Musk clearly wants to pressure Alameda County to let Tesla Fremont reopen quickly. If Musk did decide to shift Tesla manufacturing to another site — perhaps as part of a Cybertruck facility — several states would likely offer subsidies. But a new plant would still take 12-18 months. Moving manufacturing from California, easily the biggest state for Tesla sales, could hurt the brand among its core customers.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, there are questions about the longer-term future for any Tesla auto plant in the U.S.</p>
<p>In the fourth quarter of 2019, the Tesla Fremont facility accounted for all the company's electric-vehicle production, aside from a handful of Model 3 sedans from the brand-new Shanghai site. U.S. demand was weakening. But China demand was strong, while Tesla was still expanding into some European markets and expiring subsidies fueled demand in countries in Netherlands.</p>
<p>But in the first quarter, the Shanghai plant ramped up production, increasingly addressing China demand. U.S. demand remained soft, even with an early Model Y launch. In Europe, sales fell in many countries, with <a href="https://twitter.com/auto_schmidt/status/1255602088089915392" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Tesla's market share declining significantly</a>. Several EVs have launched in Europe this year, with the Volkswagen ID.3 line due this summer. Tesla has no more European markets to enter.</p>
<p>In the near term, auto sales overall may be weak in the U.S. and Europe due to their massive recessions. But even after an economic recovery, with Tesla sales already well off their highs in the U.S. and possibly peaking in Europe, will ex-China demand be strong enough to keep the Fremont plant busy?</p>
<p>Keep in mind that Tesla plans to build another factory outside Berlin. While construction hasn't started yet, Tesla aims to have Giga Berlin up and running by 2021.</p>
<p>So in little more than two years, the Tesla Fremont plant is set to shift from serving the world serving expanding new markets to essentially just the U.S.</p>
<p>Down the road, Tesla will have incentives to export autos from its Shanghai plant, taking further production from Fremont. If Tesla Shanghai production exceeds China demand, the pressure will build quickly.</p>
<p>If you're a Tesla bull, you can see huge growth and continued strong share in booming electric vehicle market. But if that doesn't come to pass, Tesla production capacity could soon far exceed demand.</p>
<h2>Tesla Stock</h2>
<p>Tesla stock fell 2.5% before the open Monday. Shares rose 5% to 819.42 on Friday on Fremont plant reopening hopes. TSLA stock shot up 17% for the week.</p>
<p>If the Fremont plant opens relatively soon, the Tesla stock impact may be relatively minor. But the longer the Tesla Fremont plant is closed, the bigger the drain on the company's cash will be. Meanwhile, Tesla's China sales are an issue.</p>
<p>It's not clear what a proper Tesla stock entry would be. Tesla stock broke out past a 775.05 handle entry in late April. But shares then reversed lower on April 30 and plunged further on May 1, invalidating that buy point. Tesla stock did find support at its 21-day line and rebounded last week. One could view the chart and see a new handle, with a Tesla stock buy point of 869.92.</p>
<p>But the base is extremely deep and volatile. Together with significant uncertainty about Tesla production now and demand in the coming months, investors may want to await more clarity.</p>
